data.title: Science for a changing world
data.meta_description: We provide science about the natural hazards that threaten lives and livelihoods; the water, energy, minerals, and other natural resources we rely on; the health of our ecosystems and environment; and the impacts of climate and land-use change. Our scientists develop new methods and tools to supply timely, relevant, and useful information about the Earth and its processes.
data.text:
Explore the USGS Water Data for the Nation and other USGS water resources below that are critical for monitoring, assessing, and characterizing the health and availability of our nation’s water assets. “WaterAlert” is real-time data from USGS monitoring locations that are transmitted, in most cases, once every hour. Emergency transmissions, such as during floods, may be more frequent. Get notifications for changes in water conditions based on thresholds you choose. USGS science supports national priorities and local communities from coast-to-coast.

We monitor, assess, map, and conduct targeted scientific research so that policy makers and the public have the understanding they need to address complex environmental, natural resource, and public safety issues.
